Text.Value: *No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him. The only problem is - where to find him?*
Wizard - was your brain entirely liquified during the battle? The fight is over, it's time to move on.

EditorData.NodeContext: impatient

Text.Value: And I thought you wise enough to recognise that I am not the man I once was.

EditorData.NodeContext: slightly disappointed

Text.Value: Though, first - Gale. What is it you plan to do next?

EditorData.NodeContext: Catching herself as the party was just about to decide on a celebration - Gale's a mind flayer, and shouldn't be forgotten.

Text.Value: Right. I suppose there is more work to do, now. What first?

EditorData.NodeContext: After a moment of leavetaking / catharsis after winning our final battle. Sighing, drawing herself up for the next task despite her exhaustion

Text.Value: If I salvage the stones, I could retrieve it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party.
EditorData.NodeContext: subtly excited

Text.Value: I cannot imagine the strength it must take to deny yourself access to the world. Your benevolence truly knows no bounds.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*

EditorData.NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

Text.Value: With the Crown in my hands, I would be unstoppable.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited by the prospect of power

Text.Value: It's not your fault - I can hardly expect you to understand. But nor will I relinquish this chance because you are unwilling to imagine a world where I succeed.

EditorData.NodeContext: like talking to a child who's too young to know about these things, but with genuine sadness when he speaks of being sad to leave you

Text.Value: I feel the faintest pricklings of hunger from the orb already. It will not remain under the sway of his spell forever.

EditorData.NodeContext: he knows his time on this earth might be limited, but isn't sad about it - just pondering what it means

Text.Value: I am seldom one to imbibe, but even I shall make an exception on a day like today.

EditorData.NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

Text.Value: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.
I can't fault your ambition. I don't know if I'd pick a fight with Mystra myself, but more power to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

Text.Value: But what about you, Gale? What will you do now...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

Text.Value: Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.
Reforge the Crown. Offer it to Mystra, hope that it's enough for her to cure you of the orb.
I've never been on first-name terms with a god before. It could have its perks.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: *But it seems that Gale's mind is elsewhere.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale joins the player in their introspective view of the bay.

Text.Value: Someone should write of your adventures. What better biographer can there be than you?
A wise suggestion.

EditorData.NodeContext: calm agreement

Text.Value: How about you? Any thoughts on what's next?

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] addressing avatar

Text.Value: *Not to mention a comfy armchair, a roaring fire, and a glass of fine wine.*
A wise man learns from his mistakes, and strives not to repeat them. I shall bring the Crown to Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: firm in his resolve

Text.Value: You should seek out Elminster. He might have a more permanent cure.
You should seek out Elminster. He might have a more permanent cure.
I shall miss him. Though I hope he proves to be a kindly god - I have had my fill of the tyrannical sort.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: As for us, well... the future awaits.

EditorData.NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

Text.Value: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you were taught to hate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
*You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

Text.Value: You promised me godhood, Gale.
You promised me godhood, Gale.
Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?
*You are a mind flayer, the very thing you were taught to hate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*
*You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: If you can fake a reflection by flipping the player upsidedown under the water, this would be a good place to do it.

Text.Value: Boo wins the bet. Wizards are not entirely boring.

EditorData.NodeContext: Satisfied sigh

Text.Value: You'll make a fine god, but I can't go with you. I'm sorry.
You'll make a fine god, but I can't go with you. I'm sorry.
Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give it to Mystra like she asked.
Such power was not meant for mortals, Gale. You should give it to Mystra like she asked.
I do wonder how he'll fare when Mystra decides to crush him. It could be quite the show.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

Text.Value: I hope she does. And we see each other again soon, both less explosive than ever before.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: So, what comes now? A bath certainly wouldn't go amiss...
You are a wise enough man to know that one should not expect kindness from the gods, Gale.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: What's our leader have to say?

EditorData.NodeContext: addressing avatar

Text.Value: I would be more than the greatest wizard who ever lived - I would be a god.

EditorData.NodeContext: emotions rising at the prospect of GODHOOD

Text.Value: Well, if that's everything - and I sincerely hope it is - we should find a tavern and celebrate. We've certainly earned it.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

Text.Value: As it is, our future is uncertain, and we must face it without divinity, without our illithid powers, as mortals.

EditorData.NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

Text.Value: What does it matter? You're a mind flayer. This world is yours.
There are so many places you've yet to explore, and not much time left to see them. Better get started.
But I think right of choosing should fall to you. What'll it be?

EditorData.NodeContext: addressing avatar

Text.Value: Perhaps one day the planes will quake as Mystra and Gale clash for control of the Weave. I would not bet against our wizard if it does come to pass.

EditorData.NodeContext: thoughtful - anticipating the prospect with some excitement

Text.Value: *Mystra's summons still stands. Bring the Crown to her and she may yet offer you a cure, but there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Knows Mystra wants to speak to you
EditorData.NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of doing what Mystra says

Text.Value: Such a force of destruction deserves to rust in a watery grave. And I've no intention of diving down to salvage it.

EditorData.NodeContext: firm in his resolve

Text.Value: Perhaps it's best you leave it where it is. Lest anyone should ever again be tempted by such power.
Perhaps it's best you leave it where it is. Lest anyone should ever again be tempted by such power.
Gale? You seem distracted - does something trouble you?

EditorData.NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

Text.Value: Of course she will. The world has no need for a goddess who would hesitate at such a request from her champion. I hope to see you again, Gale.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: Mystra no longer wishes to share his bed. Boo doubts she will wish to share the mastery of all magic with him instead.

EditorData.NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

EditorData.stateContext:
Player and Gale on the pier together

Dragon and Lae'zel have left

Text.Value: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.
Then we should make tonight count. After that, I fear you'll be too dangerous to stay with me.
Then we should make tonight count. After that, I fear you'll be too dangerous to stay with me.
Better for the world not to find out at all, I think. And certainly better for Gale that Mystra does not.

EditorData.NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

Text.Value: *...Or you could find some other place to deploy them. Some other purpose, some other cause more befitting a mind flayer.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: If recruited Karlach, go to: END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach. If not, go to: RomanceFates/SoloFates.

Text.Value: You're content to leave the Crown where it lies? I'd have thought you'd want to claim it?
You're content to leave the Crown where it lies? I'd have thought you'd want to claim it?
I will never forget you - that much I promise. And if one day you feel differently, I would be honoured to have you as my Chosen.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little pompous, likes the idea of this shifted dynamic between you. Meant sincerely though.

Text.Value: I suggest we take a moment to rest, recuperate, and drink the nectars of victory.

EditorData.NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

Text.Value: *It is not without sadness that you leave this world, but locked away, at least the people in it will be safe.*

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become a god

Text.Value: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.
And you, Gale? What are your next steps?
*Already you feel the orb straining against the confines of Elminster's spell. It will not hold forever. How will you spend the time that you have left?*
Better yet, you'll be her Chosen again.
Better yet, you'll be her Chosen again.
As long as you're not expecting anyone to follow you... I wish you all the best. Though I have a feeling you'll be just fine.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: I'm sure Mystra will summon me soon enough, but until then, I propose we celebrate our victory the mortal way - with a drink in our hands, and reckless abandon in our hearts.

EditorData.NodeContext: with enthusiasm and joy

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale turns back to face party.

It's time I leave you. I must reforge the Crown. If I offer it to Mystra, perhaps she'll cure me of the orb.

Perhaps. I can't speak to the qualities of Mystra, but I can certainly speak to those of her servant.

Are you sure you're ready to give up such powers? You'll never have the chance again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion]

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale, determined, the course is set

A ghaik with a conscience... remarkable. I would not have wished for such a fate for you, but perhaps it is for the best.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The player turns from the skies back to the bay. They walk out to the docks to watch the dying rays of the sun ripple across the water.

We could start similar to the Dragon's Arrive Stage from END_BrainBattle_CombatOver, but it's probably simpler to cut to a neutral shot and walk down to the docks.

Text.Value: But I leave the final call to our esteemed leader.

Text.Value: *Of one thing you may be assured - the world will be safe from the Crown's power, thanks to you - Gale of Waterdeep, the wizard who defeated a Netherbrain.*

EditorData.NodeContext: morally good outcome for Gale

EditorData.NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

Text.Value: And once I have, I'll return it to Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

Text.Value: *Perhaps the Underdark. With your death, you might even eradicate others of your kind from the face of this realm.*

EditorData.logicalname: SUICIDE BUT NOT IN THIS MOMENT

Text.Value: It's I who should be saying such things. Do not think I leave you without a heart as heavy as your own. But I owe it to myself to follow where destiny leads.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a smile

Text.Value: No kind the world will suffer for the absence of. And, I hope, there are plenty on mortal soil who would regret my absence.

EditorData.NodeContext: Glad to relinquish this particular ambition (godhood), and appreciating the bonds he's made on the journey

Text.Value: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.
You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.
And once I have, I'll take it to Mystra.

EditorData.NodeContext: feeling his way to a decision
EditorData.logicalname: NOT MET MYSTRA + NO CROWN WANTS

Text.Value: I understand. You are right to heed such doubts, however much sadness it brings me to leave you behind.
What do you think? Time for a quick one, before the work begins again?

EditorData.NodeContext: addressing avatar

Text.Value: *You could start with Oryndoll, and perhaps later, Glyth itself. The world is yours to uncover, its stories yours to tell.*
I'm sorry you feel this is necessary... but I understand. You really are just like me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting with sadness to mind flayer player deciding to put themselves in prison

Text.Value: *The Karsite Weave palpates within you - stirred by the very prospect.*

EditorData.NodeContext: the power within Gale resonating at the prospect of more power

Text.Value: Wear it, and become a god?
Wear it, and become a god?
*Perhaps Mystra will recognise you for your humility, perhaps not.*
Fear not - the orb is quite safe for the time being. I've a window in which to consider my options.

EditorData.NodeContext: reassuring

Text.Value: Gale, are you brooding? Because I swear, if you ruin my good mood...

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

Text.Value: *Or... you could take control of it for yourself, and become a god.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speculating on the other path Gale could take (the ambitious one) - becoming a god and having absolute power

Text.Value: But it's a journey I'd rather set out on with a good meal and a rest to my name. And a nightcap wouldn't go amiss.

EditorData.NodeContext: warm, happy

Text.Value: What shall we do next?
I think a celebration is in order. It's the least we deserve.

EditorData.NodeContext: Like clearing her throat so as to move the party on from scene of battle towards more joyous things

Text.Value: I'm not sure about 'drink in hand', but I think we've all earned some reckless abandon.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

Text.Value: *You could take the Crown to Mystra, perhaps leverage it for a cure. But there is no guarantee that she will be in a forgiving mood.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale weighing internally pros and cons of interacting with Mystra at this critical juncture

Text.Value: Ugh, no. Having seen what we've seen of those who chase godhood, I'm quite content with my mortality.

EditorData.NodeContext: confident, calm

Text.Value: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*
Ambitious - don't let Mystra hear you say that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

Text.Value: Why should I?

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter

Text.Value: But, let the wizard wet his robes in the river, if that is his wish.

EditorData.NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

Text.Value: I can't say I'm not a little thankful. You've been lucid for quite some time now, and from what I understand, you won't stay that way for long.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: Only a cruel god would refuse you. May Mystra's wisdom prevail over her enmity.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic (in her own way) to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: Ahead of us, I hope. I've a feeling we've many more adventures to come.

EditorData.NodeContext: positive, warm

Text.Value: *And what of the orb? Will you still be able to control when it explodes when you can barely control yourself?*
It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The illithid that defeated the Netherbrain.
It's time the Crown had a new owner - you. The wizard that defeated the Netherbrain.
I'm sure it will come to pass. Find me when it's done - I'll want to hear your story.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: *Waterdeep is waiting for you - it's time to go home.*
I envy him. If we had dominated the brain, we would be greater than gods.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*
If anyone can, it's you, Gale. Whether you should is a question you might consider, though.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly

Text.Value: But what then? What would I do with it, once I have it?

EditorData.NodeContext: contemplation drawing a mental blank

Text.Value: She'll cure me of my affliction, and I'll finally be free.

EditorData.NodeContext: sure of himself - this is the right thing to do

Text.Value: It's not exactly the outcome Elminster hoped I would achieve, but it's the best I could do with the time his charm bought for me.

EditorData.NodeContext: justifying his peace out loud

Text.Value: Once Gale tasted of godhood, he was always bound to fill himself full. May he be wiser than he is cocksure, for his own sake.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: Such nobility and self-sacrifice. I thought a mind flayer might have a stronger sense of self-preservation than that, but... well - goodbye.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: That might be the smartest thing you've ever said, Gale.

EditorData.NodeContext: amused

Text.Value: The power of Karsus would be in my hands...

EditorData.NodeContext: contemplative

Text.Value: What is it, wizard? There will be plenty to furrow our brows over in the morning - why not take a break?

EditorData.NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

Text.Value: Such power was not meant for mortals. Retrieve the Crown, and give it to Mystra, as she asked.
Such power was not meant for mortals. Retrieve the Crown, and give it to Mystra, as she asked.
Such ambition - you make me look positively humble.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Gale has expressed his desire to be a god.

Text.Value: But he's set himself on his path. We have our own next steps to think on.

EditorData.NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

Text.Value: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*
Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.
Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.
Speak your troubles - or relinquish them.

EditorData.NodeContext: slightly impatent - Gale clearly has something on his mind

Text.Value: Now you're talking. After all that, I think I'll need a drink in each hand, and a third on the table.

EditorData.NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

Text.Value: I will never forget you - that I promise. And if you ever feel differently, there will be a place waiting for you in the heavens.

EditorData.NodeContext: with affection towards a loved one

Text.Value: You'll tell me if you're about to blow, won't you?
You'll tell me if you're about to blow, won't you?
Who needs forever? Keep it fed and you've plenty of adventures still ahead of you.
Who needs forever? Keep it fed and you've plenty of adventures still ahead of you.
Only cowards submit to slavery or imprisonment willingly. If you do not trust your own mind, you should have the courage to destroy yourself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: Would anyone else like to sit down? Lie down? Drink until we fall down, perhaps?

EditorData.NodeContext: Breaking a moment of high tension / catharsis with a genuinely exhausted sigh.

Text.Value: Another low mortal, grasping at godhood. Perhaps he will manage it, and be everything he promises - perhaps not.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: Regardless, it's the right thing to do. That's good enough for me.

EditorData.NodeContext: confident, calm

Text.Value: A celebration sounds ideal. Whatever time I have left, I'd like to spend it with you.
You seem distracted, wizard. I can no longer spy your thoughts - so speak them.
But somehow I do not think Mystra will allow it to happen so readily.

EditorData.NodeContext: but not that much concern

Text.Value: *What will you do next?*
*The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar. You will salvage the stones and reforge the Crown, the power of Netheril in your hands at last.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain
EditorData.logicalname: GALE KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING CROWN + MET MYSTRA

Text.Value: Perhaps it's time for a celebration. We have earned it.

EditorData.NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, ready to move on from the scene of battle to a pub

Text.Value: Perhaps, or she might just reject you again.
Perhaps, or she might just reject you again.
You go on ahead. I miss Waterdeep, and I'd like to go home.

EditorData.stateContext:
Player and Gale on the pier together

Dragon and Lae'zel have left

Text.Value: Revelry? A grand notion - we've earned the right to an indulgence or two.

EditorData.NodeContext: surprised to hear Gale say it, but very much on board

Text.Value: Well, my friend? What do you say?

EditorData.NodeContext: addressing avatar

Text.Value: Gale? Is something the matter?

EditorData.NodeContext: in a good mood, wondering why Gale isn't

Text.Value: Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.
Good luck, Gale. Don't forget me when you're a god.
Though first - what of you, wizard?
The risk to others is too great. You will have to take your life. But somewhere far away from here.
A sound idea. It shouldn't take long to find him either - a wizard who cannot refrain from imparting his wisdom to the world... well, you know yourself how easy it is to find one of those.

EditorData.NodeContext:
the thought had crossed his mind perhaps but it's good to hear it affirmed by you
latter part is a joke about himself

EditorData.stateContext:
Player and Gale on the pier together

Dragon and Lae'zel have left

Text.Value: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.
*A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*
Mystra has dictated the terms of my potential for long enough. The Crown would grant me control of my own destiny at last.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter

Text.Value: Is that really what you want, Gale?
Is that really what you want, Gale?
No one else wishes to say it? Very well, then. DRINKING!

EditorData.NodeContext: Looking around, clearing throat before 'DRINKING!'

Text.Value: Your hubris was your downfall once, Gale. I thought you were wiser than to make the same mistake again.
Your hubris was your downfall once, Gale. I thought you were wiser than to make the same mistake again.
Although it seems not everyone is in the mood to celebrate. What's happening in that head of yours, Gale?

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] being sensitive to Gale's somewhat thougthful mood

EditorData.stateContext:
Player and Gale on the pier together

Dragon and Lae'zel have left

Text.Value: But what awaits you, Gale? Your path ahead is... unclear.

EditorData.NodeContext: Uncertain (Gale is a mind flayer in this case, having transformed to save the day)

Text.Value: Of course, your other condition. But if anything can convince your god to do what's right, the Crown can.

EditorData.NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: A new chapter awaits - let us make haste.

EditorData.NodeContext: more interested in what's happening in the here and now

Text.Value: Well and good, but enough of that. What now? My hamster is hungry.
You finally have a chance to live. Embrace it.
A nip, a dance, and a song? Don't mind if I do - I think we're due an evening's reprieve.

EditorData.NodeContext: Eager (game over, time to go celebrate)

Text.Value: Don't do it, Gale. Stay here, with me.
Don't do it, Gale. Stay here, with me.
We will be gods together, Gale. I will be right by your side.
We will be gods together, Gale. I will be right by your side.
Though I hope he has the mettle needed to face Mystra. She will not yield willingly, I fear...

EditorData.NodeContext: doubtful that Gale's god would allow him to become one

Text.Value: There should be no mind flayer roaming freely, not even you. Put yourself in prison.
A grand enough gesture to win back her good graces, I think. I wish you luck, wizard.

EditorData.NodeContext: sympathetic to Gale's desire to be cured of the bomb in his chest

Text.Value: *It will not be without sadness that you depart your friends, but at least they will be safe.*
Do not be sad, mind flayer. Even out of sight, Boo will remember you. And I will make sure he reminds me to remember you also.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: Besides, I've grown quite fond of this merry band of ours, and I'd quite like to see what happens to it.

EditorData.NodeContext: tonal shift towards levity the way British people do as soon as they've had an emotion

Text.Value: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

EditorData.stateContext:
Player and Gale on the pier together

Dragon and Lae'zel have left

Text.Value: I fell to hubris once before and landed myself with this orb. I think I'd rather not make the same mistake again.

EditorData.NodeContext: his resolve is beginning to form

Text.Value: If you think iron bars will be enough to contain you, I fear you'll be in for a rather nasty shock. It's your mind that is your greatest asset, always has been. That's the one I'd watch.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a mind flayer player saying they'll lock themselves in prison for everyone's safety.

Text.Value: Gale will be but one god among many - doomed to squabble, to battle, to vie for control and power. And we will be the pieces they play with.

EditorData.NodeContext: with concern - Gale has left, declaring he plans to salvage the crown and become a god.

Text.Value: Gale - this is no time for sentimental gawking.
*The very air around you thrums with anticipation, and fear. Can you really handle such power, such authority?*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale contemplating his newfound power, feeling his isolation from his surroundings and his party
EditorData.NodeContext: speaking of Gale, who is fairly sure he's about to become a god

Text.Value: *The Crown is in the depths of the Chionthar, waiting for your summons. You have the means to reforge it, and revive the power of Netheril anew.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Speaking of Gale, a mind flayer, who knows that he could reforge the Crown of Karsus - the very thing that allowed the Netherbrain to be dominated and become the Netherbrain
EditorData.logicalname: ILLITHID GALE KNOWS ABOUT REFORGING + MET MYSTRA

Text.Value: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?
*Perhaps there will be rats or other thoughtful vermin that you might sustain yourself on. Or, if you're lucky, a cellmate.*
A humble task ahead, then. And one in which your Mystra will no doubt wish you well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gale has expressed his desire to be a god, but you have your doubts - his goddess Mystra was never the kind to grant power willy nilly. Jaheira's line mildly sarcastic - 'oh, is that all'

Text.Value: I think we've earned a celebration. Don't you?

EditorData.NodeContext: While Gale seems to be moping, trying to move the party on  from the scene of battle to a pub

Text.Value: *You felt the magic of Karsus draining from the stones as the Crown plummeted to the bottom of the Chionthar. A useless trinket, nothing more.*
What comes now? I cannot remember the last time we did not have a grand purpose to work towards...

Synopsis:
The githyanki have already departed on their red dragons. Laezel can join them or not if shes present.
Karlach leaves to die (in END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach). 
Towards the end of the dialogue, the party members wonder what to do next.

JLatino: I believe Orpheus cannot appear in this sequence, he will always have departed. Looks like this can mostly take place on the pier.

EXITS:
